lines.text:
[Perrin has just had another accident]
This must not be his day.
It's *never* his day.

[to Perrin]
Life was a bore before I met you.

[explaining to Campana why Perrin should help find Marie Bens]
A man like you can't do it; you're normal. But an unlucky guy will slip on the same banana peels she does. *He* can find her.

[to Campana, talking about Perrin]
He was hired two years ago. I tested him then; I've observed him since. He's phenomenal.
He looks normal, though.
He was a seven-month baby, and guess what happened to his incubator? It broke down.
I don't believe in bad luck. Bullshit!
You heard of Eugene Delacroix, the painter?
Yes.

At three, he was nearly strangled by a curtain cord. Then his mosquito net caught fire; he was badly burned. While he was recovering, he was dropped into some water. By a miracle, he was saved but then he choked on some grapes. That is all absolutely true; Delacroix is an example of incredible bad luck.

[to Campana]
You've been unlucky so far, but with me that will change.

[to Campana, on board the plane to Brazil before it takes off]
Do you like to fly? I love to, but last time we had a problem... we almost crashed. It was at Orly; the wing flaps got stuck. We nosed into a field.
[Campana stares at Perrin]
Happens often, it seems.

[to Campana, talking about Mademoiselle Martin]
I like her... she helped me up when I was electrocuted.
Electrocuted?
At the office, plugging in the orange juice machine.
[he looks up at Campana and smiles]
I got juice, all right.

[Campana has just realized that Arbal, the man they're looking for, was in the gambling club they just left]
Okay, you have no memory for faces; it's no tragedy.

[he's just been shot]
Nothing but trouble... I knew it.
[he dies]

[to Perrin]
I don't believe in magic! I believe in logic! Do you know what logic is? I'm a rational, logical man! I don't rely on coincidence to solve a case!

[he's just realized that Perrin is sinking in quicksand]
What's happening now?
I don't know... I'm sinking.
Why?
I don't know why.
Stop clowning when I talk to you!
I'm not clowning! I'm really sinking!
Why aren't *I* sinking?
You're on good sand and I'm in quicksand. *You're* the one who wanted a short cut!
And you don't even react?
If I do, I'll go in farther... everyone knows that!
Perrin, they didn't show any quicksand on the map!
Then it's time they did!

[Campana has just pulled Perrin out of the quicksand; Perrin laughs]
Shit! I lost a shoe!

[slowly smiles and also laughs]
Don't you ever rest?

[the guards are coming to their cell]
Here they come! They'll pick one of us at random and beat him to a pulp! That's their idea of fun!

[to Campana]
What'd he day?

[looks hard at Perrin]
They'll beat one of us up.
[he keeps staring at Perrin]

[finally notices Campana staring at him]
Why stare at me that way?
[Campana shrugs]

[to Mr. Bens]
Until we have proof she's dead, I won't believe it! She';s had too much bad luck for us to give up hope! She has a fantastic guardian angel! He's had so much work with her that he's an expert! We've got to trust him!

[he notices Campana's shoelace is untied]
Your shoestring...

[kneels down to tie his shoelace; it breaks. He stares at it, then at Perrin, almost scared]
I broke it!
It's no tragedy.

[standing up, staring at the broken shoelace in his hand]
It's a sign.
A sign of what?

[pause, then]
Never mind.

[to Campana]
So much has happened to me since I met you.

[looks at Perrin, then]
To me too.

[he hands Perrin his gun]
You need this more than I do.

[they've arrived at the mission; it's a total ruin and deserted]
Did an earthquake do this?
Or a tornado. It reminds me of my parents' house. They had one near Paris.
A tornado in Paris?
No, I left the gas on and...
[he flips a hand up to indicate what happened, then walks off. Campana stares after him]
